definition: warlike
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
to fight/fight/war/battle

sentences.english: The Arevaci are a warlike people.
sentences.chinese: 阿雷瓦西人是好戰的族羣。

sentences.english: "A whole nation of belligerent, snappish people?" asked Nikolai.
sentences.chinese: “一個全國好戰的國家？急躁的人民？”尼可萊問。

sentences.english: Countries and their people get frustrated because they have so little.
sentences.chinese: 一個國家和她的人民變得好戰是因爲他們擁有的少。

sentences.english: Two other militant leaders gave up their weapons on Saturday.
sentences.chinese: 週六，其他兩名好戰分子領袖已經繳出武器。

sentences.english: Directed by the warlike Inanna, he penetrates the Sinai peninsula, invades Egypt.
sentences.chinese: 受到好戰的伊娜娜指引，他滲透西奈半島，入侵埃及。

sentences.english: The Afghans I met were neither xenophobic nor bellicose.
sentences.chinese: 我遇到的阿富汗人既不排外，也不好戰。

sentences.english: There were also pugnacious certainties guaranteed to incite the war's critics.
sentences.chinese: 其中好戰的言論肯定能激怒戰爭評論家。

sentences.english: The lasting we want it a trigger-happy general at the disarmament talks.
sentences.chinese: 在裁軍會談中我們最不喜歡的是好戰的將軍。

sentences.english: A militant attitude often betrays an inner turmoil.
sentences.chinese: 好戰的姿態常常顯露了內心的騷動。
這些好戰的川普支持者。

sentences.english: This respect cannot be earned through belligerence.
sentences.chinese: 好戰的態度無法贏得這種尊重。

sentences.english: Her increasing belligerence alienated her from her old friends.
sentences.chinese: 她的日益增長的好戰性使她和她的老朋友們疏遠了。

sentences.english: A whole nation of belligerent , snappish people ?
US is the biggest war monger and a oil thief.
sentences.chinese: 美國纔是最大的好戰者和石油竊賊。

sentences.english: Tactical communications network sufficiently militant signal equipment primarily.
sentences.chinese: 戰術通信網足以好戰通信裝備爲主。

definition: to act in collusion (idiom); in cahoots with/villains will look after one another
enemy country
public sentiment
scramble for power and profit (idiom); power struggle
to watch the fires burning across the river/to delay entering the fray until all others have been exhausted by fighting amongst themselves (idiom)
to fight openly and maneuver covertly (idiom)
to become enemies/to become hostile towards
to lose one's standing/to have one's reputation swept away/a complete defeat and fall from grace
to strive
to set a trap
harmful teachings/evil doctrine
fight
to fool the world and usurp a good name (idiom)
lit. to invert black and white (idiom); to distort the truth deliberately/to misrepresent the facts/to invert right and wrong
to fight with all one's might
the whole country in rebellion
